data.name: Trevenant

attacks.name: Shadow Cage
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it's kind.

data.name: Fennekin
data.flavorText: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

abilities.name: Ancient Fang
abilities.text: As long as you have Kabuto, Kabutops, or Kabutops ex in play, Omastar's attacks do 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

abilities.name: Gift Exchange
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Delibird is your Active Pokémon, you may shuffle 1 card from your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card. This power can't be used if Delibird is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Souvenir
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, put 4 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If 2 of them are heads, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon. If all of them are heads, put 10 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If all of them are tails, remove all damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all effects of those coin flips and being flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Stored Power
attacks.text: Move all Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

data.name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

data.name: Grumpig

attacks.name: Psychic Lock
attacks.text: Your opponent can't use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Bench Manipulation
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin for each of his or her Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage times the number of tails. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 3 of them. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Clefairy from your hand onto Cleffa (this counts as evolving Cleffa) and remove all damage counters from Cleffa.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Induction
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Explosive Thunder
attacks.text: Discard all basic Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded.

data.flavorText: It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.

data.name: Houndoom

attacks.name: Dark Fang
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Black Fire
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire or Darkness Energy attached to Houndoom. If you discard a Fire Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If you discard a Darkness Energy, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.

data.name: Espeon ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

abilities.name: Purple Ray
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Espeon Star from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Electivire

abilities.name: Motor Drive
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electivire. This power can't be used if Electivire is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electivire. Flip a coin for each Lightning Energy you discarded. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

abilities.name: Solar Eclipse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lunatone is in play, you may use this power. Until the end of your turn, Solrock's type is Fire. This power can't be used if Solrock is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Cosmic Draw
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 3 cards.

data.name: Jolteon

abilities.name: Electromagnetic Wall
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.

data.name: Mesprit

abilities.name: Upper Material
abilities.text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, the Retreat Cost for each Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf (both yours and your opponent's) is 0.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: You may switch Mesprit with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. After doing damage, flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused.

data.name: Seadra

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional-medicine ingredients.

data.name: Phione

attacks.name: Evolution Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.

abilities.name: Smooth Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Magcargo is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

abilities.name: Attract Energy
abilities.text: When you play Magneton from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your other Pokémon to Magneton.

attacks.name: Electric Blast
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Magneton when you use this attack. If you do, put damage counters equal to the amount of Energy cards removed in this way on any number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon in the way you like. (For example, if you discard 3 Lightning Energy cards, you can put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and 2 on another.)

attacks.name: Snapping Pincers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Overhead Toss
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If tails, choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Carnivine

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Carnivine. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Carnivine's, this attack does 60 damage instead.

attacks.name: Wring Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

data.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It's both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.

data.name: Gossifleur

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

data.name: Ho-Oh-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Rebirth
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may flip a coin. If heads, put this Pokémon onto your Bench and attach 3 different types of basic Energy cards from the discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each different type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Blaziken

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch it foes.

abilities.name: Fellowship
abilities.text: Bellossom can use the attacks of all Oddish, Gloom, Vileplume, Vileplume ex, or other Bellossom you have in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Aqua Flower
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Bellossom has no Weakness.

data.name: Victini-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Energize
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Weepinbell

attacks.name: Burning Venom
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

data.name: Numel

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees F. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

data.name: Foongus

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

data.name: Umbreon
data.flavorText: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Breloom.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flame Jet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pansear

attacks.name: Double Fire
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

data.name: Skiddo

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vortex Chop
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

data.flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

data.name: Vaporeon

abilities.name: Aqua Effect
abilities.text: Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a Water Pokémon in addition to its existing types.

data.flavorText: It has evolved to be suitable for an aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.

data.name: Voltorb

abilities.name: Floating Electrons
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

data.name: Sealeo

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.

data.name: Squirtle

abilities.name: Floating Shell
abilities.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Honedge

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Slash attack's base damage is 40.

data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

data.name: Alcremie V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sugary Sprinkles
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sweet Splash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Bounsweet

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Sandslash

abilities.name: Slush Rush
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.

data.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

data.name: Infernape

abilities.name: Flaming Fighter
abilities.text: Put 6 damage counters instead of 2 on your opponent's Burned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

data.name: Slowking

abilities.name: Mind Games
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card, you may flip a coin. If heads, that card does nothing. Put it on top of your opponent's deck. This power can't be used if Slowking is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mind Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

data.flavorText: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke's head and unlocked an extraordinary power.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Dark Ursaring

attacks.name: Provoke
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Baby Pokémon and/or Basic Pokémon there, you may put any number of them onto your opponent's Bench (as long as there's room). Then, your opponent looks at your hand. If you have any Baby Pokémon and/or Basic Pokémon there, your opponent may put any number of them onto your Bench (as long as there's room).

attacks.name: Battle Frenzy
attacks.text: For each Pokémon in play (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. For each heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack.

data.flavorText: Its keen nose can pick out any scent, even that of food buried deep underground.

data.name: Frillish

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.

abilities.name: Chaos Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent has 3 or fewer Prizes, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: Switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Land Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Team Magma's Rhydon.

data.name: White Kyurem

attacks.name: Burning Icicles
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Holon's Magneton
rules: You may attach this as an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon that already has an Energy card attached to it. When you attach this card, return an Energy card attached to that Pokémon to your hand. While attached, this card is a Special Energy card and provides every type of Energy but 2 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Grovyle during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Kiss
attacks.text: If there are 2 Defending Pokémon in play, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (If there is only 1 Defending Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Fast Stream
attacks.text: Move 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to the other Defending Pokémon. (Ignore this effect if your opponent has only 1 Defending Pokémon.)

data.name: Hypno

abilities.name: Sleep Pendulum
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Hypno is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic Shot
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.

data.name: Kingdra

attacks.name: Genetic Memory
attacks.text: Use any attack from Kingdra's Basic Pokémon card or Evolution card. (Kingdra doesn't have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and discard it. If both are tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

data.flavorText: It sleeps deep on the ocean floor to build its energy. It is said to cause tornadoes as it wakes.

abilities.name: Nurse Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Nurse Call Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Blissey does 60 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Team Rocket's Meowth

attacks.name: Miraculous Comeback
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Then Team Rocket's Meowth does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is more active at night. It likes bright, shiny things and cannot resist taking them and adding them to its collection.

data.name: Metagross

attacks.name: Quad Smash
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It folds its four legs when flying. Its four brains are said to be superior to a supercomputer.

data.name: Celebi ◇
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

attacks.name: Time Distortion
attacks.text: Devolve any number of your Benched Pokémon as many times as you like. Put each Evolution card removed this way into your hand.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.

attacks.name: Pick On
attacks.text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, look at his or her hand. Choose a number of cards there until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand and have your opponent shuffle the cards you chose into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Power Count
attacks.text: Count the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon and all of your opponent's Pokémon. If your Pokémon have less Energy than your opponent's, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Politoed

abilities.name: Enthusiasm
abilities.text: If you have Poliwag, Poliwhirl, and Poliwrath in play, each of these Pokémon's attacks does 60 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It gathers groups of others as their leader. Its cries make Poliwag obey.

data.name: Magcargo

attacks.name: Magma Mantle
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fire Energy card, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.

data.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

data.name: Camerupt

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years—or whenever it becomes really angry.

abilities.name: Crush Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If not, put the card back on your deck. This power can't be used if Walrein is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage plus Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Sudowoodo doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.)

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Sudowoodo. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Reshiram-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Fossil Hunt
attacks.text: Put 2 Item cards that have Fossil in their names from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

abilities.name: Snow Veil
abilities.text: As long as Abomasnow is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Snow Play
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, excluding Grass Pokémon and Water Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Below Zero
attacks.text: If Abomasnow evolved from Snover during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Wingull
data.flavorText: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.

abilities.name: Lazy
abilities.text: As long as Slaking is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Critical Move
attacks.text: Discard a basic Energy card attached to Slaking or this attack does nothing. Slaking can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Dark Arbok

attacks.name: Stare
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.) If that Pokémon has a Pokémon Power, that power stops working until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Vapor
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Freezes its prey with its stare. If you should encounter one, remember not to look into its eyes.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Hurricane Call
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

data.name: Pelipper

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

data.name: Volbeat

attacks.name: Pheromone Catch
attacks.text: If your Illumise used Pheromone Signals during your last turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.

data.name: Victini

attacks.name: V-create
attacks.text: If you have 4 or fewer Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Xurkitree

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cablegram
attacks.text: If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Colorless Basic Pokémon or Basic Pokémon with Team Magma in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Play
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play with Team Magma in its name.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.

data.name: Jellicent

attacks.name: Meddling
attacks.text: Attach 3 Energy cards from your opponent's discard pile to his or her Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Ensnaring Spray
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.

data.name: Hypno

attacks.name: Dream Catcher
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, move all damage counters from Hypno to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even if someone just woke up.

data.name: Mime Jr.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.

attacks.name: Mime
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

data.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Fighting Fury
abilities.text: Each of your Fighting Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Machamp Crush
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.

abilities.name: Undevelop
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Flareon and put Flareon into your hand. This power can't be used if Flareon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Evolving Flare
attacks.text: If Flareon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Bay Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, if any of your current Active Pokémon does damage to any Defending Pokémon, the attack does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Eldegoss

attacks.name: Blessing of Fluff
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

data.name: Steelix

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

data.flavorText: Its body has been compressed deep under the ground. As a result, it is even harder than a diamond.

data.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gastro Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon has no Abilities until the end of your next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

data.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy of that type. You can't use this power if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

attacks.name: Poison Buildup
attacks.text: Koga's Arbok is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Power
attacks.text: If Koga's Arbok is Poisoned, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 20 and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Team Magma's Lairon

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: When Lairon uses Take Down, the impact from its solid body is enough to destroy concrete!

data.name: Staryu

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal all damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

data.name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Typhoon
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Cycler
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Then, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Bronzong is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Strange Spin
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Heavy Potential
attacks.text: Put a number of damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon equal to the number of Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) Clefable performs that attack.

data.flavorText: Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by the full moon to play at deserted lakes.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Induction
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Explosive Thunder
attacks.text: Discard all basic Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded.

data.flavorText: It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.

data.name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.

data.name: Camerupt

attacks.name: Fire Shard
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years–or whenever it becomes really angry.

data.name: Rotom

attacks.name: Dual Trans
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Rotom to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

data.name: Servine

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

data.name: Walrein

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Big Tusk
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

data.name: Torchic

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if it is hugged.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

abilities.name: Heal Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Heal Dance Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

abilities.name: Shining Horn
abilities.text: As long as Pinsir is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Overhead Toss
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

attacks.name: Beacon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

data.name: Ampharos

attacks.name: Acceleration Bolt
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Ampharos does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

data.name: Riolu

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.text: Riolu can't be Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its body is lithe yet powerful. It can crest three mountains and cross two canyons in one night.

data.name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Deep Sea Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

data.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flame Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

data.name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Flare
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crimson Flame Pillar-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

data.name: Lugia

attacks.name: Aerowing
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

data.name: Torkoal

attacks.name: High-Pressure Heat
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's High-Pressure Heat attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.

data.name: Braixen

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

data.name: Umbreon ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

abilities.name: Dark Ray
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Umbreon Star from your hand onto your Bench, you may choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Extra Flame
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.

abilities.name: Poison Resistance
abilities.text: Zangoose can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Target Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Seviper, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Super Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Galarian Ponyta

attacks.name: Heal Pulse
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its small horn hides a healing power. With a few rubs from this Pokémon's horn, any slight wound you have will be healed.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 2 of them. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Brock's Onix can't attack during your next turn.

abilities.name: Binding Aura
abilities.text: Your opponent can't play any Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve an Active Pokémon and can't attach any Energy cards from his or her hand to an Asleep Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Soggy Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

data.name: Lopunny

abilities.name: Relaxing Shower
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Energy card from your hand. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Lopunny is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hover Heal
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from Lopunny.

data.flavorText: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

data.name: Mismagius

attacks.name: Sleeping Spell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Trainer, Supporter, and Stadium cards in your opponent's hand.]

data.flavorText: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

data.name: Amoonguss

abilities.name: Bursting Spores
abilities.text: Whenever you play a Pokémon that has the Spore attack from your hand during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Firestorm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.

data.name: Probopass

abilities.name: Steel Coating
abilities.text: Any damage done to Probopass by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 for each Metal Energy attached to Probopass (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't reduce more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Metal Bomber
attacks.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon up to the amount of Metal Energy attached to Probopass. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units call Mini-Noses.

data.name: Gogoat

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Tepig

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

data.name: Hypno

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

data.name: Lilligant

attacks.name: Bemusing Aroma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Grass Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

data.name: Volcanion

attacks.name: Power Heater
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to each of those Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

data.name: Pansage

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

data.name: Unown [A]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Anger]
abilities.text: Whenever 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name uses its Hidden Power attack, that attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Unown [A]. If you have more than 1 Unown [A] in play, use only 1 [Anger] for each attack.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

attacks.name: Quick Change
attacks.text: Choose up to 3 cards in your hand and put them on top of your deck. Then, search your deck for that many cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Tail Smash
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 damage instead. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Grubbin
data.flavorText: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

data.name: Steenee

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.

data.name: Gogoat

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Typhlosion is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from either player's Pokémon to another Pokémon (yours or your opponent's). This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Burning Ball
attacks.text: If Typhlosion has at least 2 Fire Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Light Dragonair

attacks.name: Healing Light
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Protective Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Light Dragonair.

data.flavorText: The aura it projects from its body has an effect on the surrounding climate and weather.

data.name: Alcremie VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adornment
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: G-Max Whisk
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Energy Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if Electrode would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may use this power. Electrode isn't discarded. Instead, attach it as an Energy card to 1 of your Pokémon. While attached, this card is a Special Energy card and provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)

attacks.name: Ion Blast
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 60 more damage. If you do, Electrode does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

data.name: Poochyena
data.flavorText: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Refreshing Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gold Breaker
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can't be seen when it melts away into water.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Pikachu during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Illumise

attacks.name: Pheromone Signals
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

data.name: Treecko

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

data.name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

data.name: Drapion

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

data.name: Light Lanturn

attacks.name: Searchlight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each player may choose a card from his or her discard pile and put it into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has evolved its dorsal fin to emit light, which attracts the fish it feeds on.

abilities.name: Luna Shade
abilities.text: As long as you have Lunatone in play, each player's Colorless Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lunatone and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mysterious Light
attacks.text: If Phoebe's Stadium is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Volcanion-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Steam Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Basic Fire Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Zapdos

abilities.name: Sheet Lightning
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Zapdos from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: Does 40 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

data.name: Togetic

attacks.name: Super Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an attack on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Super Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togetic's type is still Colorless.) Togetic performs that attack. (Togetic can make that attack even if it does not have the appropriate number or type of Energy attached to it necessary to make the attack.)

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Togetic; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

data.flavorText: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

data.name: Abomasnow

attacks.name: Bang Heads
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

data.flavorText: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

data.name: Dark Blastoise

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that tackles anything it sees.

data.name: Starmie

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

data.name: Deerling

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

data.name: Wooper

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

data.name: Team Magma's Aggron

attacks.name: Rock Stomp
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fighting Energy you discarded.

attacks.name: Boulder Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Aggron's metal horns can smash through any defenses, no matter how strong!

data.name: Ursaring

attacks.name: Headpress
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen berries.

abilities.name: Dragon Aura
abilities.text: As long as Rayquaza has any basic Fire Energy cards and any basic Lightning Energy cards attached to it, prevent all effects, except damage, by an opponent's attack done to Rayquaza.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Victini

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Relentless Flames
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It creates an unlimited supply of energy inside its body, which it shares with those who touch it.

data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

abilities.name: Strange Tentacles
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), as long as the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon is less than the number of Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, you may choose an Energy card, if any, in your opponent's discard pile and attach it to the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tentacruel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Trevenant

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

data.name: Torkoal

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mounts where they live.

data.name: Furret

attacks.name: Keen Eye
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Baton Pass
attacks.text: You may switch Furret with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Furret as you like to the new Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

data.name: Gyarados

abilities.name: Commotion
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wild Tail
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.flavorText: There are people who swear that any place Gyarados appears is fated for destruction.

attacks.name: Quick Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dragon Spark
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

data.name: Magcargo

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

data.name: Ledian

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.

data.name: Charizard-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Storm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard the top 10 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Zygarde
data.flavorText: This is Zygarde's form at times when it uses its overwhelming power to suppress those who endanger the ecosystem.

data.name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

data.name: Manectric

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: As long as Claydol has any Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Claydol is 0.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Seviper

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.text: Put 1 more damage counter on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.

data.name: Pansear

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Dialga.

attacks.name: Diamond Blow
attacks.text: Dialga can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga's heart beats.

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal of half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters that that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

data.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Steamroll
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.

data.name: Machop

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

data.name: Starmie

abilities.name: Escape
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.flavorText: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.

data.name: Binacle

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

data.name: Glameow

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pose
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness if very popular among some.

attacks.name: Horn Toss
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Brock's Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.

data.name: Emboar

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

data.name: Ninetales-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flare Bonus
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Torkoal

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

abilities.name: Sunny Day
abilities.text: Each of your Grass Pokémon's and Fire Pokémon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Salty-sweet Pollen
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.

data.name: Chimecho

attacks.name: Heal Bell
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Psywave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Count the amount of Energy attached to that Pokémon. Put that many damage counters on the Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon (before they affect the damage.).

abilities.name: Acid Sampler
abilities.text: As long as Victreebel is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Defending Pokémon between turns. Acid Sampler stops working if your other Active Pokémon is not a Victreebel.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Electabuzz is an Evolved Pokémon, any damage done to Electabuzz by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has any Special Energy cards attached to it is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Shock
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. If either of the coins is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Luster Blast
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Electabuzz.

abilities.name: Powder Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Ledian by attacks from Pokémon that has an owner in its name is reduced by 40.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Fire Veil
abilities.text: If Arcanine is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Arcanine is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Burn Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

data.name: Pansear

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600° F.

data.name: Mightyena

attacks.name: Hard Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.

data.name: Cyndaquil

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Camerupt

attacks.name: Eruption
