attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.

abilities.name: Rock Body
abilities.text: All damage done by attacks to Golem is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

data.name: Combusken

attacks.name: Midair Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

data.name: Cleffa

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Cleffa is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Cleffa by attacks.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards. Cleffa is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

data.name: Ninetales BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Ninetales BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Explosive Fireball
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.name: Delphox

abilities.name: Mystical Torch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degree Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

data.name: Wartortle
data.flavorText: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.

data.name: Heat Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

data.name: Dhelmise

attacks.name: Special Anchor
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.

data.name: Pidove
data.flavorText: Each follows its Trainer's orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Tsareena

attacks.name: Power Whip
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Time Out Kick
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.flavorText: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.

data.name: Rillaboom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Forest Feast
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Luvdisc

attacks.name: Heart Wink
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't draw a card at the beginning of his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

attacks.name: Chop Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

attacks.name: Bounce Off
attacks.text: If Magneton and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, the player controlling the Active Pokémon with the fewest number of Energy cards attached to it switches 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnetic Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon minus the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (For example, if your opponent has 1 Benched Pokémon and you have 3, this attack will do 30 damage plus 20 more damage.)

data.name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

data.name: Pansage

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

data.name: Regice

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Resistance Blizzard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Blaziken.

data.name: Typhlosion

abilities.name: Firestarter
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Evaporating Heat
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It attacks using blasts of fire. It creates heat shimmers with intense fire to hide itself.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

attacks.name: Beacon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.
